SEARCH
Package no.ntnu.idatx1005.view.content

Class NewTaskView

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.layout.HBox
no.ntnu.idatx1005.view.content.NewTaskView
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class NewTaskView extends javafx.scene.layout.HBox

View for the new task page.

The view extends the HBox class. The view is meant to be used as a child of the ContentView class.

Since:
V0.1.0
Author:
Tord Fosse, William Holtsdalen

    • constructUserContainer

      private javafx.scene.layout.HBox constructUserContainer(String iconName, User user)
      Constructs a new user container with a button and text. The button is either an add or remove button, depending on the given icon name. The text is the provided user's name.
      Parameters:
      iconName - the name of the icon to use for the button ("fas-plus" or "fas-minus")
      user - the user to construct the container for (used to get the user's name)
      Returns:
      the constructed user container

    • initializeAvailableUsers

      private void initializeAvailableUsers()
      Initialized the available users list view with all users in the database.

    • handleAddUserButtonAction

      private void handleAddUserButtonAction(javafx.scene.layout.HBox userContainer, User user)
      Handles the action of adding a user to the assigned users list view.
      Parameters:
      userContainer - the user container to add
      user - the user object for the userContainer

    • handleRemoveUserButtonAction

      private void handleRemoveUserButtonAction(javafx.scene.layout.HBox userContainer, User user)
      Handles the action of removing a user from the assigned users list view.
      Parameters:
      userContainer - the user container to remove
      user - the user object for the userContainer
